TopicTitle: Removing invalid parts from craft files?

Articles.Content:
Over the last few months, I have added and removed a variety of mods. Of course, this means I have several craft files that are inaccessible in the VAB due to "invalid parts".

Is there a way to identify those parts, and then remove them (automatically or manually) from the craft files, allowing the craft to be accessible again?

I've attempted to search using "invalid part", and came up with nothing useful.
You can try KSP Mod Admin, it gives you which mod is needed for parts in craft.

That did the trick. Took me a while to figure it out (deleted all my mods on accident, had to rebuild config files, etc etc) but once I got it working, it was just what I needed.

Then I discovered the part that was missing was a custom kethane scanner I had hacked togeather..so.....yea.

But otherwise, it all worked out
